attributes.action: Debate the implementation of a carbon tax in the House of Commons
attributes.background:
Climate change is currently happening and economic experts cite a carbon tax as a solid and progressive step. Reducing carbon consumption and also taxation needed from other sources. 

Carbon tax would drastically reduce the rates of income tax. More money for you and a better environment.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.carbontax.org/why-a-carbon-tax/

'A robust tax on carbon pollution will create powerful incentives inducing policy-makers and individuals to reduce carbon emissions through conservation, substitution and innovation' 

'Currently, the prices of electricity, gasoline and other fuels reflect little or none of the long-term costs from climate change or even the near-term health costs of burning fossil fuels'

attributes.action: Allow all emergency services to use spit hoods!
attributes.background: Several infectious diseases are contained in saliva, I wish this subject to be discussed in Parliament and come down on the side of all emergency services.

attributes.action: Leave the clocks on British Summer Time all year round.
attributes.background: Light evenings in the summer are widely enjoyed but it is a little depressing when the hours of daylight begin to shorten. Then there is the sudden jolt of even earlier darkness when the clocks go back one hour. Why not leave the clocks alone and allow gradual acceptance of the shorter days?
attributes.additional_details: It has been done before (1968 to 1971) and it has been debated many times. With the UK leaving the EU there will be no European requirement for a common summer time but, in effect, summer time would not be changed anyway. If businesses wish to keep in step with their international partners it should be easy enough for them to change their trading hours to suit; a side-effect of this could be to stagger business hours thus reducing rush-hour congestion and pollution. In areas such as northern Scotland where all-year BST would mean a mid-morning sunrise in the winter months surely it is not beyond the wit of men and women to adjust working hours as appropriate. Alternatively they could learn to live with it as do millions of people in other northern locations.

attributes.action: Introduce Government subsidies on public transport for full time students.
attributes.background: Studying in full time education can cost families a sufficient amount of money each year on transport to school and recreational activities which they may not have. This can cost families and students thousands of pounds every year which they can spend on other costs in the household like books.
attributes.additional_details: For a bus ticket from Seaton to Exeter it costs a student £10 for a return trip which the money can be used for a text book from school.Therefore  the government should subsidie public transport for students in full time education.

attributes.action: Halt Brexit process & seek legally binding mandate from public post-Trump
attributes.background: The recent change in the US government administration and their subsequent rhetoric and actions have placed the UK in a perilous negotiating position during the Brexit process. Reality of Brexit is also more well defined than pre-referendum meaning public opinion may have changed significantly.
attributes.additional_details: Following the election of Mr. Trump and the subsequent change in US government administration, the US has changed position on numerous issues, with controversy following certain actions too numerous to mention here. We are specifically concerned with where this leaves the UK in our Brexit negotiations given HM Government's timetable for withdrawal, in light of the overwhelming disquiet shown over aligning ourselves with the new US administration against the relative stability of EU membership.

attributes.action: All income used by self funders to pay for care needs should not be taxed.
attributes.background: Phase Two of the Care Act 2014 has been delayed, resulting in self funders having to finance care needs until their assets, including the value of the family home, fall below £23,500.  The Act included a cap on the maximum fees that could be paid. Tax relief on income for this purpose would be fair.
attributes.additional_details:
The Government Care Act Fact Sheets state: 

"These reforms aim to give everyone the peace of mind that they will be protected from catastrophic care costs by means of a cap on care costs." 

Also "The cap will limit the amount people have to pay towards the cost of their eligible care and support over their lifetime."

Delay in implementation does not protect people receiving care “from catastrophic care costs by means of a cap”.

attributes.action: Abolish employment tribunal fees.
attributes.background: We call on the Conservative Government to abolish tribunal fees which were introduced in 2013 which are severely hindering access to justice especially for those who are vulnerable.

attributes.action: Please give extra money to keep our Isle of Wight acute inpatient hospital open.
attributes.background: Hampshire and Isle of Wight Sustainability and Transformation Plan [HIOW STP] has been published. The plan is to reduce overall running costs in the area. But we might lose 300 hospital beds. Acutely ill Isle of Wight patients need inpatient facilities near to home, not "ferried to the mainland".
attributes.additional_details: https://onthewight.com/petitions-protect-health-services-on-the-isle-of-wight-gaining-support/

attributes.action: Urgently ban the use of preventative antibiotics in animal agriculture.
attributes.background: Antibiotics used in agriculture are a serious the threat to human health. Overuse is driving up levels of antibiotic resistance, leading to new superbugs. There must be a total ban on "preventative antibiotic use" where animals are given the drugs to prevent infection or speed up their growth.
attributes.additional_details:
This ban should also cover imported meat where antibiotics have been used. In many countries throughout the world animals use more antibiotics than humans. 

The use of antibiotics in farming represents a critical threat to public health. If antibiotics stop working, which is a distinct possibility, the outcome could be apocalyptic for humanity. We would go back to the days where a small cut or infection could be fatal.

No new antibiotics have been discovered since 1987.

attributes.action: Make female hygiene dispensers compulsory in all secondary schools.
attributes.background: It is not realistic to expect all individuals to be prepared for an instance where they may need sanitary products, especially in adolescence. Products should be on offer in the case of an individual finding themselves unprepared, to avoid any stress or embarrassment.

attributes.action: Enforce a minimum of 6 weeks Statutory Paternity Leave to all fathers at 90% pay
attributes.background: Fathers currently take 2 weeks paternity leave when their child is born. Mothers are entitled to 52 weeks (39 weeks paid Statutory). Fathers should spend the first 6 weeks with their babies & partners for support & bonding. Paternity leave should change to minimum 6 weeks at 90% of their salary.

attributes.action: Transfer SouthEastern and Southern services to TfL from 2018 onwards
attributes.background: This petition demands that management and accountability for London's failing Metro services is handed over to TfL and operated under London Overground. Starting with 2018 SouthEastern services to and from Dartford followed by Southern services and others as and when current franchises expire.
attributes.additional_details: Chris Grayling MP has rejected the Mayor of London's proposal to allow TfL to take full control over the failing Southern and SouthEastern franchises when they expire. The London Overground unit has a proven track record of improving punctuality, cleanliness, staffing levels and frequency. Profits are reinvested into the network meaning that services are run for the benefit of passengers. Chris Grayling made a mess of our prisons - we need to stop him doing the same to our transport.

attributes.action: Ban the testing of joined up handwriting in primary school SAT's.
attributes.background: There is currently an epidemic of illegible handwriting in our secondary schools. Primary schools have been forced to cut corners, using a continuous cursive method from Reception to simply tick the boxes of the handwriting statements in the Interim Teacher Assessment Framework.
attributes.additional_details: There is no long term benefit to this; it is simply to meet the Interim Teacher Assessment Framework handwriting statements, which contradicts the handwriting statements in the current National Curriculum. Also, we believe that it should be a statutory requirement that left handed pupils receive specific teaching to meet their needs, to help them master legible handwriting and continue to love writing.

attributes.action: Save the NHS by creating a new law to commit 11% of U.K. GDP on Healthcare
attributes.background:
The NHS is in difficulties. With a growing ageing population we need a strong healthcare system. The U.K. Spends less as a proportion of GDP than many other neighbouring countries. 
Let's stop political parties using the NHS as a political tool. Let's all agree to spend 11% of  GDP  regardless.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.kingsfund.org.uk/projects/nhs-in-a-nutshell/health-care-spending-com

attributes.action: Require the final Brexit deal with the EU to be approved by the UK Parliament
attributes.background:
The formal process of negotiating the exit of the UK from the EU includes 'consent' by MEPs in the European Parliament to the final deal. MPs in the UK Parliament should be afforded the same right as well.
If the UK Parliament fails to consent to the final Brexit deal, the UK should stay in the EU.
attributes.additional_details:
The Constitutional Reform and Governance Act 2010 details requirements around International Treaties being put before Parliament, prior to ratification.  The Government has yet to confirm its intention in this regard in respect of the final Brexit deal with the EU. (This is despite repeated requests for clarification by the Select Committee for Exiting the EU).

The UK Parliament is sovereign and its endorsement of the final Brexit deal should be required before ratification and implementation.

attributes.action: Ensure fracking is not allowed near Sherwood Forest
attributes.background:
Following a Guardian article (see link below) we would like to ensure that Ineos and any other company is not allowed to begin fracking near the historic site of the Major Oak in Sherwood Forest. 

(https://www.theguardian.com/business/2017/jan/01/robin-hoods-sherwood-forest-faces-fracking-threat)

attributes.action: State Pension Payable Immediately On Completion Of 40 Years N.I. Contributions
attributes.background: Recent State Pension changes means many people will contribute around 50 years N.I contributions before they will receive a State Pension, despite the Government themselves saying 35 years is the amount of contributions needed to create it in the first place.     Pay the pension at 40 years maximum.
attributes.additional_details: If your employer say they will pay you £10 per hour for a fifty hour week, then you only receive £350, you'd feel a little more than a little miffed - but that's exactly the "deal" we are being sold by the Government with increased retirement ages.     By their own admission, you need to pay N.I. contributions for 35 years to get a full State Pension.     So why are we expected to work longer?     Any individual completing 40 years contributions should have their pension payable from that point.

attributes.action: Ensure plastic food packaging, plates and cutlery are environmentally friendly.
attributes.background:
France has passed a new law to ensure all plastic cups, cutlery and plates are compostable and made of biologically-sourced materials.
The UK should be making plans to implement similar plastics and packaging controls in order to tackle the growing problems of pollution and climate change.
attributes.additional_details:
By 2050 there will be more plastic in our oceans than fish (World Economic Forum). Nearly a third of all plastics leak into the environment where they end up eaten by wildlife or in floating rubbish dumps in the sea.
The British government needs to take some kind of definitive action against the use of plastics in our country, if we’re going to have any chance of mitigating the problem of waste in a growing global population.

attributes.action: Dissolve the House of Lords and replace it with a new appointment process
attributes.background: We are in a situation where the house of commons appears to not represent the working class people of Great Britain. It is seen by most working class people to be an extension of the House of Lords. We need a balance of wealthy people and poor people to correctly govern the UK.
attributes.additional_details: At present we have no balance, both houses are full of highly educated individuals most from privileged backgrounds.To restore balance we need a house to represent the not so fortunate of the UK i.e low paid workers, people who live in poorer areas,  people without an education, people without the chance to change their lives. I propose we dissolve the House of Lords and replace it with a cross section of society who are selected in much the same way we already make selections for Jury service.

attributes.action: Car tax exemption for cars over 30 years old
attributes.background: Classic cars between 30 and 40 years old have to be Taxed. There needs to be more of an incentive for owners to keep these cars going. Many cars of this age are in need of restoration, they are likely uneconomical to repair. This is the way forward to encourage the protection of classic cars

attributes.action: Require packaging to state that a product has been tested on animals
attributes.background: We are petitioning for products to advertise their use or lack of cruelty-free testing as a requirement. This allows buyers to make an informed decision on products and their ethics.
attributes.additional_details: Over 3 million animals are tested on each year and many of these tests are unnecessary. The bulk of testing can be carried out digitally and therefore this cruelty to animals is unneeded.

attributes.action: Give free public transport to homeless people in UK
attributes.background: Whilst we find ways and seek solutions to Homelessness it would be a good start by offering access to public transport. This way we would offer them some respite and support that they need in order to improve their lives. Moreover, it would not cost us much as it is already there.
attributes.additional_details:
In the current climate Homelessness is rising and there are no easy solutions to this. Local Authorities are struggling to cope with the demand and are not able to house most people registered as Homeless due to the lack of Housing supply.

We believe that it would be only just fair that as a great country, United Kingdom would allow anyone who is registered as Homeless to have free public transport. This would enable them to go to work, attend job centres, hospital or housing appointments.

attributes.action: Empower the Police to seize and destroy Mobile Phones
attributes.background: So many people are killed or injured every week as a result of road traffic accidents where mobile phone distraction is the cause. Please sign & support this petition. you will be saving lives!

attributes.action: Ensure that students from year7 are taught in schools how to detect child abuse.
attributes.background: We're a group of students that believe that child abuse needs to be reduced. We have found astonishing figures that kids 4 years old and under are most affected. Most kids that have been physically, verbally or sexually abused are unaware that they are being abused as they don't understand the signs
attributes.additional_details:
Approximately 5 children die every day because of child abuse and 1 out of 3 girls and 1 out of 5 boys will be sexually abused before they reach age 18.
For every child identified as needing protection from abuse, another 8 are suffering alone

attributes.action: Ban fireworks outside of events on specific days across the UK.
attributes.background:
In the weeks around Bonfire Night, fireworks are constantly being let off causing nothing but worry for pet owners. 

The noise and vibrations from fireworks can cause severe distress in both wild and domestic animals, meaning that owners have to take steps to alleviate their distress.
attributes.additional_details:
Bonfire 'Night' is often spread over a fortnight. This means that owners can find it difficult to plan for their animals. Fireworks have caused distress to all kinds of animals, not just cats and dogs. Smaller animals, such as rabbits, and farm animals, such as horses, can be affected too. 

This petition is calling for the government to specify days of the year on which the use of fireworks is legal, e.g. 5th November, 31st December, Diwali, and to ban their use outside of these dates.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for ALL betting shops to have bandit screens
attributes.background: It should be the responsibility of the company to ensure all safety measures available are utilised to protect staff at all times. Staff safety needs to be taken  seriously and should take priority over the cost of installing preventative measures
attributes.additional_details: Many staff will feel the benefit of feeling safe in their working environment. It is not physically or mentally healthy to work in unsafe conditions. We need protecting and we need our employers to take responsibility and to take immediate action.

attributes.action: Urge Volkswagen to compensate owners of cars with emission defeat devices
attributes.background: In the US, Volkswagen have to pay $5100 to each owner affected and the owners get the option of buyback by Volkswagen of the vehicle or to wait for VW to develope a fix that can win regulatory approval.
attributes.additional_details: Emission "defeat devices" are a software Volkswagen knowingly installed in its cars to fool emission testing machines into thinking that the car is safer than it is. The software actually allows the cars affected to emit up to 40 times the legally allowable pollution, whilst cheating at the MOT emission test so that it passes. The scandal has also damaged the resale value of affected cars and as such I think it a travesty that Volkswagen do not pay compensation to owners

attributes.action: Make All Highway Contracts Fix Pot Holes Within 150 Meters Of Active Roadworks.
attributes.background:
We are all sick of hitting pot holes and getting stuck or slowed down by roadworks. 

We want to make it law that any company who closes off a highway , must repair any pothole within 150 meters of the closure.

attributes.action: Stop non-medically qualified persons administering dermal filler.
attributes.background: The aesthetics industry is poorly regulated and the number of non-medics offering dermal filler injections in the UK is growing rapidly. Concern lies mainly with theses individual's ability to assess appropriately as well as recognise and manage complications as and when they arise.
attributes.additional_details: Health professionals in the U.K are concerned about the growing number of non-medics offering dermal filler injections. Anyone can train, get insurance and start injecting members of the public with these substances. There are substantial risks associated with these treatments and whilst doctors and nurses are regulated by their own professional bodies, non-medics are not. They are not regulated or professionally accountable.

attributes.action: Increase awareness and services for those suffering from eating disorders
attributes.background: We the undersigned ask that the government both develop greater awareness and increase funding to mental health services for those suffering from an eating disorder.
attributes.additional_details: We are a group of students from the University of Exeter campaigning to raise awareness of the lack of support for sufferers of eating disorders, particularly in the South West.

attributes.action: Put pressure on Interpol, to enforce against the illegal trading of Chimps.
attributes.background: The heart-breaking BBC article (see below) details how easy it is for baby chimps to be traded illegally across waters. Putting pressure on and educating Interpol and Customs, could help more cases be uncovered and having a more severe punishment may act as a deterrent.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/resources/idt-5e8c4bac-c236-4cd9-bacc-db96d733f6cf

attributes.action: To excempt special guardians from this ruthless benefit cap.
attributes.background: Special guardians protect vulnerable children and often cannot work due to caring for these children saving them from foster care, saving the system thousands.This benefit cap is heartless towards many children and (previously looked after children and the families who care for them.  STOP THIS CAP!
attributes.additional_details: Guardians are excempt from this cap but not special guardians.... guardians are guardians both are raising children until 18 and both situations very traumatic for these children and being raised and cared for by others not birth parents. The new welfare reform has financially put us at risk! The goverment say work or we cut your money! Many can't work and have had to give up employment as many of these children have issues and need us. Should special guardians be going to A FOOD BANK??

attributes.action: Please open Reading Prison to Soup Kitchens & support grouos helping homeless.
attributes.background: Reading prison is currently empty. All we ask is whilst it is, can it be used by soup kitchens and support groups that help our Homeless community. They can have a bed, be in the warm and have use of the kitchens where they can have a hot meal.

attributes.action: Carers allowance,Caring for loved ones,by right even if claiming a State Pension
attributes.background: Mandy Bayliffe wanted " The Carers Charter " to protect all Carers from cuts and provide a framework of support via community care free at the point of need. Respite , home support and even sitting Services exempt from any charges or assessment. Many Carers die of exhaustion ,so we have to act now.
attributes.additional_details: There are almost 1.5 million Carers at home who cannot claim the allowance because they are in receipt of a State Pension, which most paid through employment. Go to www.carersassociation.info which shows all the stats in care. The allowance must be paid free of tax or any benefit assessments as with PIPS , when claiming Pension credits or Housing benefits . Child Carers must receive Education credits for when they may wish to move on to College on University . This will help reduce their fees .

attributes.action: Throw out plans requiring voters to produce ID at polling stations
attributes.background: The UK government has announced plans to trial asking voters to produce ID before being allowed to vote. If this law was to be passed then it will be unfairly affecting the poor, the marginalised, the homeless, the isolated and the most vulnerable sections of our society. It needs to be stopped.

attributes.action: Amend spelling expectations for end of Key Stage 2 assessment
attributes.background: It is almost impossible for children with spelling difficulties to reach ‘the expected standard’ in writing.Two small concessions would make a big difference-removal of spelling from teacher assessment of writing and reporting on the outcomes of the spelling test,separate from grammar & punctuation.
attributes.additional_details: Contrary to what the Bew review of assessment recommended, anyone currently working in a primary school, or with any knowledge of the assessment expectations, will know that the system that we are working with does not ensure that ‘the achievement of all pupils with Special Educational Needs is appropriately recognised’. They will also know that the secure fit approach to teacher assessment does not enable writing composition to form the greater part of writing assessment.

attributes.action: Allow all high risk cancer patients to have annual check up scans nationwide.
attributes.background:
I would like patients at high risk of their cancer returning or at high risk of being diagnosed with metastatic cancer to have life saving annual check ups no matter where they live. 
At the moment this is a postcode lottery. 
Please sign my petition. 
It may save your life or a loved ones life.
attributes.additional_details:
My Name is Stacey. At the age of 26 I was given just weeks to live due to an aggressive form of ovarian cancer. I have two young children and I married my husband from my hospital bed.
After pioneering last resort radical surgery by Christina Fotopoulo my life was saved.
Despite the cancer being very likely to return and unlikely to be caught in time without regular scans I was horrified to discover that the NHS do not offer check up scans to all high risk patients like me. 
Help save a life.

attributes.action: Make it Compulsory for Bus/Taxi Road lanes Surfaces be Colour Coded
attributes.background: Don't you hate it when you're away from home in unfamiliar surroundings then drive down a Bus/Taxi Land not knowing because it's not displayed properly then getting a fine.
attributes.additional_details: Get road surface colour coded where necessary

attributes.action: All Government forms, publications in English or English/Welsh languages only.
attributes.background:
All Government forms and publications should be printed in English or English/Welsh languages only.
The public sector is estimated to spend  140 million a year on translation services.
attributes.additional_details:
Local councils spend at least £25m; the police £21m; the courts system spends more than £10m without accounting for the cost of legal aid; and the NHS - a conservative estimate is £55m.
The Human Rights Act only requires translation if someone is arrested or charged with a criminal offence.
Translating is not only expensive it is doing harm because it reinforces the language barrier which separates communities from the rest of Britain and hinders integration.

attributes.action: Make breeding animals without a licence a criminal offence.
attributes.background: Each year "ALMOST 50,000 pet dogs are being dumped by owners in Britain every year – with healthy animals being exterminated every TWO hours by agencies who are struggling to cope".  "Authorities killed 5,142 stray dogs last year as Britain's abandoned pet crisis shows little sign of being solved".
attributes.additional_details: If animals weren't so readily available to buy on the internet/private sales, if demand was far greater than the supply thus prices weren't so competitive/affordable then people wouldn't be so quick to buy one and be so irresponsible and careless once they become pet owners.  I would like licensed breeders ONLY to sell pets in order for the government to have better control over the pet population/welfare,  and a better approach to who animals are sold to, some form of vetting would be ideal.

attributes.action: Extend the Animal Welfare Act 2006 to include crustaceans
attributes.background:
Crustaceans are not covered by existing animal welfare legislation. 
The Animal Welfare Act 2006 states that its protection can be extended to other types of animals if it can be proven that they are capable of experiencing pain.
Scientific evidence proves that crustaceans do feel pain.
attributes.additional_details:
There is much scientific evidence to suggest that crustaceans feel pain.
As crustaceans are not in the animal welfare act, they can be killed in any way. This usually involves boiling them or hacking them to pieces whilst they are still alive. 
Animal welfare organisations are calling for greater protection for these animals, based on sound scientific evidence and the provision in the Act.
Reference: RSPCA, Animal Aid and Shellfish network

attributes.action: Stop the NHS wasting more time in the courts: Commission PrEP immediately.
attributes.background: PrEP stands for Pre-Exposure Prophylaxis. It's a course of HIV drugs for HIV negative people to take before sex to reduce their risk of contracting HIV. Research demonstrates that PrEP is as effective as condoms in preventing HIV transmission.
attributes.additional_details:
In March 2016 NHS England stated that they were 'not responsible for commissioning PrEP’. Following a legal challenge from the National AIDS Trust, which the NHS wasted time and money appealing, the Court of Appeal has ruled that the NHS has the legal power to fund PrEP. 

The NHS’s decision has already been delayed for over 6 months, so we urgently call on Jeremy Hunt to make PrEP available on the NHS. 

Every day the NHS delays its decision, 17 more people will be diagnosed with HIV.

attributes.action: Ensure the Royal Navy does not lose its long-range anti-ship missile capability
attributes.background:
The MoD has admitted that the Royal Navy's Harpoon anti-ship missile will go out of service in 2018 with no replacement specified. The shorter range Sea Skua missile also goes out of service, not to be replaced until 2020.

This means the Royal Navy will lack a ship-killing capability for sometime
attributes.additional_details:
Rear-Adml Chris Parry, said: "It's a significant capability gap and the Government is being irresponsible. It just shows that our warships are for the shop window and not for fighting."

Lord West of Spithead, a former First Sea Lord, said: “This is just another example of where the lack of money is squeezing and making the nation less safe. We will have this gap of several years without missiles. Well, that’s fine if you don’t have to fight anybody in the meantime.”

attributes.action: Form a Home or National Defence Force of HM Forces Veterans.
attributes.background: There are thousands of able and willing HM Forces Veterans who would step forward if required to form a Home or National Defence Force to assist in Border Protection or assistance to Police and regular Forces in times of emergency, or civil unrest.
attributes.additional_details: These Veterans are a valuable asset to this Nation, well trained, experienced and able to fulfill tasks and roles during times of emergency or civil unrest.

attributes.action: Stop the UK from recognising child marriage conducted abroad as legal.
attributes.background:
The UK recognises child marriage provided they were conducted "legally" abroad & also for benefit purposes.
It is illegal to marry under 18 yrs of age in the UK (16 years with parental consent) & these child marriages should not be recognised by the UK in any form. The adult should be prosecuted.
attributes.additional_details:
Today Save the Children estimated that a girl marries under the age of 15 years every 7 second seconds within the world.
In recognising the child marriages of immigrants to the UK (including for benefit purposes) we do nothing to stop this child abuse.

attributes.action: Allow parliament to vote on whether or not we stay within the single market
attributes.background: People voted for brexit thinking it would be done in an orderly fashion with an input from everyone in parliament, not by a committee created by an unelected prime minister. Brexit should be done with everyone in mind, no one asked for a crippled pound and a damage to the economy.
attributes.additional_details: The European Single Market enables free trade within the EU, helping 26 million UK businesses and access to a market worth over £9 trillion. Membership of the single market would allow us to enjoy the same trade benefits and support British companies even after we have left the EU. Continued tariff-free trade will preserve confidence in the British economy, but with Theresa May's current plan, it would require leaving the block, our economy will go down and the working/middle class will suffer.

attributes.action: Recognise non-binary people legally
attributes.background: We would like those who identify as non-binary, genderqueer, gender non conforming, or any other similar identity to be recognised in the eyes of British law.
attributes.additional_details: Recognising us legally means that the discrimination against non binary individuals will be reduced, as anti-discriminatory laws can be enforced to prosecute people illegally targeting us- this will also act as a deterrent for other people who discriminate on the grounds of gender identity and expression.

attributes.action: We would like the UK to have an official National Emergency Services Day.
attributes.background:
Emergency services are often overlooked and forgotten about with regards to saying thank you for what you do.
We believe a National Emergency Services day should be held to recognise the good work our blue light services do.
attributes.additional_details: Most of the time when the public come into contact with emergency services, something bad has happened, this has a detrimental effect on both the public and members of the blue light community. By having an official National Emergency Services day and by holding community events across the country this would allow the public to engage and see another side of the great work they do.

attributes.action: Increase verification to decrease the fraud in scrapping a stolen vehicle.
attributes.background:
Vehicles presented for scrapping by a thief can currently disappear if no V5 is presented on arrival at the scrapyard.
There is no electronic information or cross checking link between DVLA and police forces in the UK.
Remove the facility of cashing the cheque to the thief by the scrapyard.
attributes.additional_details: This follows an incident with a rare vehicle which after being stolen, disappeared, was effectively crushed, and all that happened before any checks could be made.

attributes.action: Government to debate epilepsy in 2017. We all need HM Government help.
attributes.background: We need MPs help to get epilepsy recognised and recognised in schools. Employers to understand and to place us all in jobs.
attributes.additional_details:
To date teachers, employees and the majority of the public fail to recognise what epilepsy is and how to deal with it. 

We are normal everyday people who in suffer from an illness. Please give us a chance in life.
